thread.title: Saturday Kitchen viewers are turned off by giant octopus that has to be "scared" before cooking
thread.title_full: Saturday Kitchen viewers are turned off by giant octopus that has to be "scared" before cooking

author: Suchandrika Chakrabarti
title: Saturday Kitchen viewers are turned off by giant octopus that has to be "scared" before cooking
text:
TV Saturday Kitchen viewers are turned off by giant octopus that has to be "scared" before cooking Barrafina chef Nieves Barragán cooked the "beautiful" octopus but the possibly-hungover audience can't handle it - although Una Healy's a fan Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Saturday Kitchen viewers are turned off by giant octopus Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Saturday Kitchen viewers waking up to their favourite show simply cannot take the giant octopus that that a Spanish-born chef prepared. 
Nieves Barragán Mohacho of Soho's Barrafina "scared" the octopus for cooking, by tipping it into a vat of boiling water. 
She confesses to getting through "10 litres of olive oil a day. People love it!" 
The large and rather oily tentacled creature looks rather alarming before being fully cooked . 
Today's show was hosted by chef Matt Tebutt, and featured The Saturdays singer Una Healy. Chef Nieves Barragán Mohacho knows her way round an octopus (Photo: BBC) The Barrafina chef is not messing about with that tentacled treat (Photo: BBC) A whole plateful of octopus on offer... (Photo: BBC) Read More Saturday Kitchen viewers slam old footage of Keith Floyd for cooking ostrich eggs WHILE surrounded by ostriches 
Una does get a bit confused by beef cheek later on, checking if it's the "cheek of the face," and not another part of the body. 
Despite 'bad fish experiences', Una enjoyed the octopus dish. She did have a nice cod at her wedding, so clearly isn't against maritime food at all. 
Una married rugby star Ben Foden in her native Ireland back in 2012, after four years of dating. They have two children, Aoife Belle, 4 and Tadhg John, 2. Una talks about the new, more country direction that her music's taking (Photo: BBC) Una gamely tucks into the octopus (Photo: BBC) Una Healy and Ben Foden on their wedding day in 2012, when they served up cod to guests (Photo: Twitter) 
Michel Roux Jr awkwardly flirts with Rebecca Ferguson on Saturday Kitchen and Twitter can't deal 
However, it does look as though some of the show's fans will never be the same after the seeing 'Nieves' Octopus'. 
One tweeted a very scary pic of a monstrous octopus, claiming she was just nipping out to get ingredients. 
Another tweeter just used an evocative gif of Dawson's Creek star James van der Beek's very expressive face. 
Other highlights of today's show include Rick Stein trying "fetid"-smelling durian fruit in Thailand, which surprisingly tastes wonderfully of custard, despite the "pooey odour." 
"It's almost the smell of south-east Asia," he adds, "You think drains, you think rather dirty rivers, you think... pong!" 
Viewers had some complicated feelings about that one... poll loading Which would you rather eat? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
